title: Interest groups min. impact on parl. systems

content.prompt: Interest groups tend to have a minimal impact on individual legislators in parliamentary systems because

choices.label: interest groups are less common in parliamentary democracies
corporatism brings together interest groups and government representatives
legislators in parliamentary systems do not represent constituency interests
election campaigns are funded by the state and do not require much fund-raising
the strength of political parties gives individual legislators less power over policy

unit.text: 4: Party and Electoral Systems and Citizen Organizations

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
